title: Implement basic REPL loop (read-eval-print with interpreter)
body:
Implement a basic read-eval-print loop using the GRIN interpreter.

**Deliverables:**
- REPL binary / mode: `rusholme repl` or `rusholme --interactive`
- Read a line of Haskell from stdin
- Parse as either an expression or a declaration
- If expression: typecheck, desugar, translate to GRIN, evaluate, print result
- If declaration: add to the environment (accumulate bindings across the session)
- Handle `:quit`, `:type <expr>`, `:load <file>` commands
- Graceful error handling (parse/type errors don't crash the REPL)
- Basic line editing (use a C library like linenoise via Zig C interop)

**Design notes:**
- Unlike GHCi, Rusholme's REPL uses the same evaluation path as batch compilation (interpreter)
- This is a DESIGN.md goal: 'more uniform than GHCi's bytecode approach'
- Start simple; auto-completion and multi-line input come later
